Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui

Class GameBoardController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.gui.GameBoardController
public class GameBoardController
extends java.lang.Object
Handles the interaction between client and server during the Game. Allows displaying the current state of the Game Board and all the notifications from the beginning until the end of the Game.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    private class  GameBoardController.HighlightCell
    Represents a clickable highlight on the board.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameBoardController

      public GameBoardController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(GUIManager manager)
      Parameters:
      manager - the GUIManager to set the GameBoardController manager attribute to

    • initialize

      public void initialize​(GameView game)
      Creates all the data structure that are needed to handle the displaying of the Game Board. Saves the nicknames of the players that are participating to the Game and their God Cards. Calls three methods that will respectively handle the initialization of the Workers, the initialization of the buildings and the initialization of the information panels surrounding the Board.
      Parameters:
      game - the GameView representing the current state of the Game

    • initWorkers

      public void initWorkers()
      Handles the initialization of all the ImageViews used to represent red, green and blue workers. An ArrayList of two ImageViews is used for each color. This ArrayList is put in an HashMap (which key is the Worker's color) to simplify the access to the ImageViews. If setting up for a 2-players Game, only red and green Workers are added. If setting up for a 3-players Game, blue Workers are added too.

    • initBuildings

      public void initBuildings()
      Handles the initialization of all the ImageViews used to highlight the Board cells when the Player is asked to make a choice. An ImageView representing the highlight is added over each Board Cell and will be set as visible when needed.

    • initInfoPanels

      public void initInfoPanels()
      Handles the initialization of all the information panels surrounding the Board, setting as visible the Players' nicknames, colors and God Cards icons. Prepares full ImageViews of the God Cards that will be displayed when a God Power is used. In a 3-player game, prepares opaque panels that will hide a Player when they're eliminated.

    • displayGameInfo

      public void displayGameInfo​(GameView game, java.lang.String desc)
      Allows displaying the received information on screen or on the Log. If the information tells about the elimination of a player in a 3-players Game, it is handled.
      Parameters:
      game - the GameView representing the current state of the Game
      desc - the information to display

    • eliminatePlayer

      private void eliminatePlayer​(GameView game, java.lang.String desc)
      Handles the elimination of a Player in a 3-players Game, removing his Workers from the Board and showing an opaque panel on his nickname. If the Player receiving the message is the eliminated one, he is notified of his loss. Otherwise, all the other Players are notified that a player was eliminated.
      Parameters:
      game - the GameView representing the current state of the Game
      desc - the reason the Player was eliminated

    • chooseStartingPlayer

      public void chooseStartingPlayer()
      Allows the Player to choose the starting Player. Sets the Player highlight to visible and waits for his choice. When the Player clicks on the one who will start, provides to notice his choice.

    • sendStartingPlayer

      public void sendStartingPlayer​(java.lang.Integer value)
      When a Player is asked to choose the starting Player, this method provides sending his choice to the GUIManager, which will process it and send it to the server.
      Parameters:
      value - the Integer corresponding to the starting player

    • choosePosition

      public void choosePosition​(java.util.ArrayList<CellView> positions, java.lang.String desc)
      Allows choosing a position between all those positions available. The available positions are highlighted and the reason of the choice is written in the textBox.
      Parameters:
      positions - an ArrayList containing CellViews representing all the available positions
      desc - the reason of the choice

    • sendPosition

      public void sendPosition​(GameBoardController.HighlightCell cell)
      When a Player is asked to choose a position between the highlighted ones, this method allows notifying the GUIManager of the choice, which will process it and send it to the server.
      Parameters:
      cell - the selected cell

    • displayPlaceWorker

      public void displayPlaceWorker​(CellView position)
      Allows displaying the placing down of Workers on the Board. The correct worker is set to visible in his starting position.
      Parameters:
      position - the CellView representing the position of the Worker

    • displayMove

      public void displayMove​(java.util.HashMap<CellView,​CellView> moves, CardView godCard)
      Allows displaying the move of a Worker or of a couple of Workers during a turn. Writes on the log the starting and the final positions. Creates a Transition which shows each involved Worker moving from the starting position to the final position. If the move was allowed thanks to a God Power, shows its images fading before the move is displayed.
      Parameters:
      moves - an HashMap containing pairs of (starting position, final position) for each worker who moved or was forced to move
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this move

    • displayBuild

      public void displayBuild​(CellView buildPosition, CardView godCard)
      Allows displaying the build of a Worker during a turn. Writes on the log the level and the position of the build. Creates a Transition which shows the new building appearing on its position. If the build was allowed thanks to a God Power, shows its images fading before the build is displayed
      Parameters:
      buildPosition - the CellView representing the position of the building
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card which eventually allowed this move

    • addGodSplash

      private javafx.animation.SequentialTransition addGodSplash​(javafx.animation.Transition transition, CardView godCard)
      Allows creating a new SequentialTransition including the Transition received as argument (which represents a move or a build) and a new FadeTransition showing the involved God Power fading in and out.
      Parameters:
      transition - the starting transition
      godCard - the CardView representing the God Card involved in the current turn
      Returns:
      a new SequentialTransition

    • chooseYesNo

      public void chooseYesNo​(java.lang.String query)
      Allows the Player to answer to the "yes or no question" received as argument. The question is written in the textBox and two buttons to choose "yes" or "no" are set to visible.
      Parameters:
      query - the "yes or no question" the Player should answer to

    • notifyLoss

      public void notifyLoss​(java.lang.String reason, PlayerView player)
      Notifies a Player that he lost. Shows him a defeat screen, reporting that he lost and the reason of his loss.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason of the loss
      player - the PlayerView representing the Player who eventually won, can be null

    • notifyWin

      public void notifyWin​(java.lang.String reason)
      Notifies a Player that he won. Shows him a victory screen, reporting that he won and the reason of his victory.
      Parameters:
      reason - the reason of the victory

    • displayMessage

      public void displayMessage​(java.lang.String query)

    • pushToLog

      private void pushToLog​(java.lang.String message)
      Parameters:
      message - the String to be written on the Log
